bibl.title: Letter from W. E. Deeks to Florence M. Read, January 2, 1924

div1.p: Deeks sends Read correspondence related to a case of suspected malaria on board a ship. He says that the diagnosis was verified by blood examination.

div1.head: Letter from W. E. Deeks to Florence M. Read, January 2, 1924
div1.opener:
UNITED FRUIT COMPANY
Medical Department
17 Battery Place
New York City
January 2, 1924
Miss Florence M. Read
International Health Board
Rockefeller Foundation
New York
Dear Miss Read:
div1.p:
We are enclosing further correspondence enc. 1; enc. 2; enc. 3 pertaining to
the death of James S. Roudabush shortly after he left our S.S.
“Saramacca” at Havana. You will observe that the diagnosis of
Malaria was apparently verified by blood examination.
Will you kindly return the enclosures for our files.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, (signed) W. E. Deeks
General Manager JSC:B
Copy to Dr. P. F. Murphy
